intro: Goniothalamus tapisoides, commonly known as the Tapisoides tree, is a tropical evergreen species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces fragrant, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by fleshy, yellow-orange berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest for both horticultural and conservation purposes.
